statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Providence 79, Brown 63
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Ryan Gomes scored 24 points and grabbed 15 rebounds Monday night, leading Providence to a 79-63 win over Brown. The Friars (9-4) won their fourth straight game after losing four of six. It was also Providence's 21st win in the last 23 games against Brown in the 112th meeting between the schools. Gomes, who hit 10 of 13 shots from the field, recorded his 38th career double-double and scored over 20 points for the fifth time in six games. Dwight Brewington added 15 points for Providence. Luke Ruscoe led Brown (6-6) with 12 points. After Brown's Damon Huffman drove and scored to tie it at 24, the Friars took charge with a 18-5 run over the final 7:38 of the half and led 42-29 at halftime. Brown went the final 5:48 of the half without a basket. Rob McKiver started the run with a 3-pointer from the top of the key, Gomes had a 3-pointer and McKiver added another one minute, 12 seconds later, making it 37-28. In the second half, PC opened with a 7-0 run before Brown ended an 8:06 drought without a basket on Huffman's layup. PC leads the series 87-25.
